result.execSummary:
The defendant Precious L Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01-29-16/ Judge William S Pocan
On ther motion of the State, the Court orders restitution set at $0.



To Nathan Z.  to be determined.  Hearing 1/29/2016.

Pay all costs, fees restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, but DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one (1) year Initial Confinement in this case.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims Nathan Z. and Corey C.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.addlTxt: As to count 1:  The petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest, order filed and signed by the Court.  Copies forwarded to parties.

Bail Refund Packets
2/2/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Precious L Brooks in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Precious L Brooks in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On the motion of the state, the Court orders restitution in the amount at $0 (ZERO).

Defendant Precious L Brooks in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 14 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
*Mental healthassessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Nathan Z. and Corey C.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Anger Management.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution to Nathan Z. to be determined.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 26.  Restitution hearing calendared for January 29, 2016 at 1:30 pm.
Case to be passed to this afternoon, counsel not available.  Case adjourned for sentencing on November 20, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Precious L Brooks in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.

AS TO COUNTS 2-4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2, 3 & 4 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Precious L Brooks in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 26
Atty Jeff Schwarz appears by phone from Intake Court and moves to withdraw as new counsel has been retained.  Court will grant change in counsel. Case remains calendared for 10-12-2015 in Branch 26.

Defense motion to modify bail argued and granted by the Court.   Court ordered that the Defendant does not drive without a valid license. Court ordered cash bail to be set at $1,000.

Defendant Precious L Brooks in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Precious L Brooks in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nathan Z or Corey C

Defendant Precious L Brooks in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Precious L Brooks in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
